summary.long: Genesis is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the earth was formless and empty, darkness was over the surface of the deep, and the Spirit of God was hovering over the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said, “Let there be light,” and there was light.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: God saw that the light was good, and he separated the light from the darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God called the light “day,” and the darkness he called “night.” And there was evening, and there was morning—the first day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said, “Let there be a vault between the waters to separate water from water.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: So God made the vault and separated the water under the vault from the water above it. And it was so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God called the vault “sky.” And there was evening, and there was morning—the second day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said, “Let the water under the sky be gathered to one place, and let dry ground appear.” And it was so.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: God called the dry ground “land,” and the gathered waters he called “seas.” And God saw that it was good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God said, “Let the land produce vegetation: seed-bearing plants and trees on the land that bear fruit with seed in it, according to their various kinds.” And it was so.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: The land produced vegetation: plants bearing seed according to their kinds and trees bearing fruit with seed in it according to their kinds. And God saw that it was good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was evening, and there was morning—the third day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said, “Let there be lights in the vault of the sky to separate the day from the night, and let them serve as signs to mark sacred times, and days and years,
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: and let them be lights in the vault of the sky to give light on the earth.” And it was so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God made two great lights—the greater light to govern the day and the lesser light to govern the night. He also made the stars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God set them in the vault of the sky to give light on the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to govern the day and the night, and to separate light from darkness. And God saw that it was good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was evening, and there was morning—the fourth day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said, “Let the water teem with living creatures, and let birds fly above the earth across the vault of the sky.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: So God created the great creatures of the sea and every living thing with which the water teems and that moves about in it, according to their kinds, and every winged bird according to its kind. And God saw that it was good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God blessed them and said, “Be fruitful and increase in number and fill the water in the seas, and let the birds increase on the earth.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And there was evening, and there was morning—the fifth day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said, “Let the land produce living creatures according to their kinds: the livestock, the creatures that move along the ground, and the wild animals, each according to its kind.” And it was so.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: God made the wild animals according to their kinds, the livestock according to their kinds, and all the creatures that move along the ground according to their kinds. And God saw that it was good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God said, “Let us make mankind in our image, in our likeness, so that they may rule over the fish in the sea and the birds in the sky, over the livestock and all the wild animals, and over all the creatures that move along the ground.”
verses.speaker: God
Narrator

verses.text: God blessed them and said to them, “Be fruitful and increase in number; fill the earth and subdue it. Rule over the fish in the sea and the birds in the sky and over every living creature that moves on the ground.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: Then God said, “I give you every seed-bearing plant on the face of the whole earth and every tree that has fruit with seed in it. They will be yours for food.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: And to all the beasts of the earth and all the birds in the sky and all the creatures that move along the ground—everything that has the breath of life in it—I give every green plant for food.” And it was so.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: God saw all that he had made, and it was very good. And there was evening, and there was morning—the sixth day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus the heavens and the earth were completed in all their vast array.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By the seventh day God had finished the work he had been doing; so on the seventh day he rested from all his work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God blessed the seventh day and made it holy, because on it he rested from all the work of creating that he had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the account of the heavens and the earth when they were created, when the Lord God made the earth and the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now no shrub had yet appeared on the earth and no plant had yet sprung up, for the Lord God had not sent rain on the earth and there was no one to work the ground,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but streams came up from the earth and watered the whole surface of the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord God formed a man from the dust of the ground and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life, and the man became a living being.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord God had planted a garden in the east, in Eden; and there he put the man he had formed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord God made all kinds of trees grow out of the ground—trees that were pleasing to the eye and good for food. In the middle of the garden were the tree of life and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A river watering the garden flowed from Eden; from there it was separated into four headwaters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The name of the first is the Pishon; it winds through the entire land of Havilah, where there is gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (The gold of that land is good; aromatic resin and onyx are also there.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The name of the second river is the Gihon; it winds through the entire land of Cush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The name of the third river is the Tigris; it runs along the east side of Ashur. And the fourth river is the Euphrates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord God took the man and put him in the Garden of Eden to work it and take care of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord God commanded the man, “You are free to eat from any tree in the garden;
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: but you must not eat from the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, for when you eat from it you will certainly die.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: The Lord God said, “It is not good for the man to be alone. I will make a helper suitable for him.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: Now the Lord God had formed out of the ground all the wild animals and all the birds in the sky. He brought them to the man to see what he would name them; and whatever the man called each living creature, that was its name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So the man gave names to all the livestock, the birds in the sky and all the wild animals.
But for Adam no suitable helper was found.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord God caused the man to fall into a deep sleep; and while he was sleeping, he took one of the man’s ribs and then closed up the place with flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord God made a woman from the rib he had taken out of the man, and he brought her to the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The man said,
“This is now bone of my bones
    and flesh of my flesh;
she shall be called ‘woman,’
    for she was taken out of man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is why a man leaves his father and mother and is united to his wife, and they become one flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Adam and his wife were both naked, and they felt no shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the serpent was more crafty than any of the wild animals the Lord God had made. He said to the woman, “Did God really say, ‘You must not eat from any tree in the garden’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said to the serpent, “We may eat fruit from the trees in the garden,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but God did say, ‘You must not eat fruit from the tree that is in the middle of the garden, and you must not touch it, or you will die.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You will not certainly die,” the serpent said to the woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For God knows that when you eat from it your eyes will be opened, and you will be like God, knowing good and evil.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the woman saw that the fruit of the tree was good for food and pleasing to the eye, and also desirable for gaining wisdom, she took some and ate it. She also gave some to her husband, who was with her, and he ate it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the eyes of both of them were opened, and they realized they were naked; so they sewed fig leaves together and made coverings for themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the man and his wife heard the sound of the Lord God as he was walking in the garden in the cool of the day, and they hid from the Lord God among the trees of the garden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord God called to the man, “Where are you?”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: He answered, “I heard you in the garden, and I was afraid because I was naked; so I hid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Who told you that you were naked? Have you eaten from the tree that I commanded you not to eat from?”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: The man said, “The woman you put here with me—she gave me some fruit from the tree, and I ate it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord God said to the woman, “What is this you have done?”
The woman said, “The serpent deceived me, and I ate.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text:
So the Lord God said to the serpent, “Because you have done this,
“Cursed are you above all livestock
    and all wild animals!
You will crawl on your belly
    and you will eat dust
    all the days of your life.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text:
And I will put enmity
    between you and the woman,
    and between your offspring and hers;
he will crush your head,
    and you will strike his heel.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text:
To the woman he said,
“I will make your pains in childbearing very severe;
    with painful labor you will give birth to children.
Your desire will be for your husband,
    and he will rule over you.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text:
To Adam he said, “Because you listened to your wife and ate fruit from the tree about which I commanded you, ‘You must not eat from it,’
“Cursed is the ground because of you;
    through painful toil you will eat food from it
    all the days of your life.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text:
It will produce thorns and thistles for you,
    and you will eat the plants of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By the sweat of your brow
    you will eat your food
until you return to the ground,
    since from it you were taken;
for dust you are
    and to dust you will return.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: Adam named his wife Eve, because she would become the mother of all the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord God made garments of skin for Adam and his wife and clothed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord God said, “The man has now become like one of us, knowing good and evil. He must not be allowed to reach out his hand and take also from the tree of life and eat, and live forever.”
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: So the Lord God banished him from the Garden of Eden to work the ground from which he had been taken.
verses.speaker: God

verses.text: After he drove the man out, he placed on the east side of the Garden of Eden cherubim and a flaming sword flashing back and forth to guard the way to the tree of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Adam made love to his wife Eve, and she became pregnant and gave birth to Cain. She said, “With the help of the Lord I have brought forth a man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Later she gave birth to his brother Abel.
Now Abel kept flocks, and Cain worked the soil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the course of time Cain brought some of the fruits of the soil as an offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abel also brought an offering—fat portions from some of the firstborn of his flock. The Lord looked with favor on Abel and his offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but on Cain and his offering he did not look with favor. So Cain was very angry, and his face was downcast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Cain, “Why are you angry? Why is your face downcast?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you do what is right, will you not be accepted? But if you do not do what is right, sin is crouching at your door; it desires to have you, but you must rule over it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Cain said to his brother Abel, “Let’s go out to the field.” While they were in the field, Cain attacked his brother Abel and killed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord said to Cain, “Where is your brother Abel?”
“I don’t know,” he replied. “Am I my brother’s keeper?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “What have you done? Listen! Your brother’s blood cries out to me from the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now you are under a curse and driven from the ground, which opened its mouth to receive your brother’s blood from your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you work the ground, it will no longer yield its crops for you. You will be a restless wanderer on the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cain said to the Lord, “My punishment is more than I can bear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Today you are driving me from the land, and I will be hidden from your presence; I will be a restless wanderer on the earth, and whoever finds me will kill me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to him, “Not so; anyone who kills Cain will suffer vengeance seven times over.” Then the Lord put a mark on Cain so that no one who found him would kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Cain went out from the Lord’s presence and lived in the land of Nod, east of Eden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cain made love to his wife, and she became pregnant and gave birth to Enoch. Cain was then building a city, and he named it after his son Enoch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Enoch was born Irad, and Irad was the father of Mehujael, and Mehujael was the father of Methushael, and Methushael was the father of Lamech.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lamech married two women, one named Adah and the other Zillah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Adah gave birth to Jabal; he was the father of those who live in tents and raise livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His brother’s name was Jubal; he was the father of all who play stringed instruments and pipes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zillah also had a son, Tubal-Cain, who forged all kinds of tools out of bronze and iron. Tubal-Cain’s sister was Naamah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lamech said to his wives,
“Adah and Zillah, listen to me;
    wives of Lamech, hear my words.
I have killed a man for wounding me,
    a young man for injuring me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If Cain is avenged seven times,
    then Lamech seventy-seven times.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Adam made love to his wife again, and she gave birth to a son and named him Seth, saying, “God has granted me another child in place of Abel, since Cain killed him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Seth also had a son, and he named him Enosh.
At that time people began to call on the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the written account of Adam’s family line.
When God created mankind, he made them in the likeness of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He created them male and female and blessed them. And he named them “Mankind” when they were created.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Adam had lived 130 years, he had a son in his own likeness, in his own image; and he named him Seth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Seth was born, Adam lived 800 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Altogether, Adam lived a total of 930 years, and then he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Seth had lived 105 years, he became the father of Enosh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he became the father of Enosh, Seth lived 807 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Altogether, Seth lived a total of 912 years, and then he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Enosh had lived 90 years, he became the father of Kenan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he became the father of Kenan, Enosh lived 815 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Altogether, Enosh lived a total of 905 years, and then he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Kenan had lived 70 years, he became the father of Mahalalel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he became the father of Mahalalel, Kenan lived 840 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Altogether, Kenan lived a total of 910 years, and then he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Mahalalel had lived 65 years, he became the father of Jared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he became the father of Jared, Mahalalel lived 830 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Altogether, Mahalalel lived a total of 895 years, and then he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jared had lived 162 years, he became the father of Enoch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he became the father of Enoch, Jared lived 800 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Altogether, Jared lived a total of 962 years, and then he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Enoch had lived 65 years, he became the father of Methuselah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he became the father of Methuselah, Enoch walked faithfully with God 300 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Altogether, Enoch lived a total of 365 years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Enoch walked faithfully with God; then he was no more, because God took him away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Methuselah had lived 187 years, he became the father of Lamech.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he became the father of Lamech, Methuselah lived 782 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Altogether, Methuselah lived a total of 969 years, and then he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Lamech had lived 182 years, he had a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He named him Noah and said, “He will comfort us in the labor and painful toil of our hands caused by the ground the Lord has cursed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Noah was born, Lamech lived 595 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Altogether, Lamech lived a total of 777 years, and then he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Noah was 500 years old, he became the father of Shem, Ham and Japheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When human beings began to increase in number on the earth and daughters were born to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the sons of God saw that the daughters of humans were beautiful, and they married any of them they chose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said, “My Spirit will not contend with humans forever, for they are mortal; their days will be a hundred and twenty years.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Nephilim were on the earth in those days—and also afterward—when the sons of God went to the daughters of humans and had children by them. They were the heroes of old, men of renown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord saw how great the wickedness of the human race had become on the earth, and that every inclination of the thoughts of the human heart was only evil all the time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord regretted that he had made human beings on the earth, and his heart was deeply troubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord said, “I will wipe from the face of the earth the human race I have created—and with them the animals, the birds and the creatures that move along the ground—for I regret that I have made them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Noah found favor in the eyes of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the account of Noah and his family.
Noah was a righteous man, blameless among the people of his time, and he walked faithfully with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Noah had three sons: Shem, Ham and Japheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the earth was corrupt in God’s sight and was full of violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God saw how corrupt the earth had become, for all the people on earth had corrupted their ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So God said to Noah, “I am going to put an end to all people, for the earth is filled with violence because of them. I am surely going to destroy both them and the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So make yourself an ark of cypress wood; make rooms in it and coat it with pitch inside and out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how you are to build it: The ark is to be three hundred cubits long, fifty cubits wide and thirty cubits high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make a roof for it, leaving below the roof an opening one cubit high all around. Put a door in the side of the ark and make lower, middle and upper decks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am going to bring floodwaters on the earth to destroy all life under the heavens, every creature that has the breath of life in it. Everything on earth will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will establish my covenant with you, and you will enter the ark—you and your sons and your wife and your sons’ wives with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to bring into the ark two of all living creatures, male and female, to keep them alive with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two of every kind of bird, of every kind of animal and of every kind of creature that moves along the ground will come to you to be kept alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to take every kind of food that is to be eaten and store it away as food for you and for them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Noah did everything just as God commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord then said to Noah, “Go into the ark, you and your whole family, because I have found you righteous in this generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take with you seven pairs of every kind of clean animal, a male and its mate, and one pair of every kind of unclean animal, a male and its mate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and also seven pairs of every kind of bird, male and female, to keep their various kinds alive throughout the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seven days from now I will send rain on the earth for forty days and forty nights, and I will wipe from the face of the earth every living creature I have made.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Noah did all that the Lord commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Noah was six hundred years old when the floodwaters came on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Noah and his sons and his wife and his sons’ wives entered the ark to escape the waters of the flood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pairs of clean and unclean animals, of birds and of all creatures that move along the ground,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: male and female, came to Noah and entered the ark, as God had commanded Noah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after the seven days the floodwaters came on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the six hundredth year of Noah’s life, on the seventeenth day of the second month—on that day all the springs of the great deep burst forth, and the floodgates of the heavens were opened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And rain fell on the earth forty days and forty nights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that very day Noah and his sons, Shem, Ham and Japheth, together with his wife and the wives of his three sons, entered the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had with them every wild animal according to its kind, all livestock according to their kinds, every creature that moves along the ground according to its kind and every bird according to its kind, everything with wings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pairs of all creatures that have the breath of life in them came to Noah and entered the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The animals going in were male and female of every living thing, as God had commanded Noah. Then the Lord shut him in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For forty days the flood kept coming on the earth, and as the waters increased they lifted the ark high above the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The waters rose and increased greatly on the earth, and the ark floated on the surface of the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They rose greatly on the earth, and all the high mountains under the entire heavens were covered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The waters rose and covered the mountains to a depth of more than fifteen cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every living thing that moved on land perished—birds, livestock, wild animals, all the creatures that swarm over the earth, and all mankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everything on dry land that had the breath of life in its nostrils died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every living thing on the face of the earth was wiped out; people and animals and the creatures that move along the ground and the birds were wiped from the earth. Only Noah was left, and those with him in the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The waters flooded the earth for a hundred and fifty days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God remembered Noah and all the wild animals and the livestock that were with him in the ark, and he sent a wind over the earth, and the waters receded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the springs of the deep and the floodgates of the heavens had been closed, and the rain had stopped falling from the sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The water receded steadily from the earth. At the end of the hundred and fifty days the water had gone down,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and on the seventeenth day of the seventh month the ark came to rest on the mountains of Ararat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The waters continued to recede until the tenth month, and on the first day of the tenth month the tops of the mountains became visible.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After forty days Noah opened a window he had made in the ark
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and sent out a raven, and it kept flying back and forth until the water had dried up from the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he sent out a dove to see if the water had receded from the surface of the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the dove could find nowhere to perch because there was water over all the surface of the earth; so it returned to Noah in the ark. He reached out his hand and took the dove and brought it back to himself in the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He waited seven more days and again sent out the dove from the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the dove returned to him in the evening, there in its beak was a freshly plucked olive leaf! Then Noah knew that the water had receded from the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He waited seven more days and sent the dove out again, but this time it did not return to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By the first day of the first month of Noah’s six hundred and first year, the water had dried up from the earth. Noah then removed the covering from the ark and saw that the surface of the ground was dry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By the twenty-seventh day of the second month the earth was completely dry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God said to Noah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Come out of the ark, you and your wife and your sons and their wives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring out every kind of living creature that is with you—the birds, the animals, and all the creatures that move along the ground—so they can multiply on the earth and be fruitful and increase in number on it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Noah came out, together with his sons and his wife and his sons’ wives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the animals and all the creatures that move along the ground and all the birds—everything that moves on land—came out of the ark, one kind after another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Noah built an altar to the Lord and, taking some of all the clean animals and clean birds, he sacrificed burnt offerings on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord smelled the pleasing aroma and said in his heart: “Never again will I curse the ground because of humans, even though every inclination of the human heart is evil from childhood. And never again will I destroy all living creatures, as I have done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“As long as the earth endures,
seedtime and harvest,
cold and heat,
summer and winter,
day and night
will never cease.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God blessed Noah and his sons, saying to them, “Be fruitful and increase in number and fill the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fear and dread of you will fall on all the beasts of the earth, and on all the birds in the sky, on every creature that moves along the ground, and on all the fish in the sea; they are given into your hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everything that lives and moves about will be food for you. Just as I gave you the green plants, I now give you everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But you must not eat meat that has its lifeblood still in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for your lifeblood I will surely demand an accounting. I will demand an accounting from every animal. And from each human being, too, I will demand an accounting for the life of another human being.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Whoever sheds human blood,
    by humans shall their blood be shed;
for in the image of God
    has God made mankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for you, be fruitful and increase in number; multiply on the earth and increase upon it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God said to Noah and to his sons with him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I now establish my covenant with you and with your descendants after you
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and with every living creature that was with you—the birds, the livestock and all the wild animals, all those that came out of the ark with you—every living creature on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I establish my covenant with you: Never again will all life be destroyed by the waters of a flood; never again will there be a flood to destroy the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God said, “This is the sign of the covenant I am making between me and you and every living creature with you, a covenant for all generations to come:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have set my rainbow in the clouds, and it will be the sign of the covenant between me and the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever I bring clouds over the earth and the rainbow appears in the clouds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will remember my covenant between me and you and all living creatures of every kind. Never again will the waters become a flood to destroy all life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever the rainbow appears in the clouds, I will see it and remember the everlasting covenant between God and all living creatures of every kind on the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So God said to Noah, “This is the sign of the covenant I have established between me and all life on the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Noah who came out of the ark were Shem, Ham and Japheth. (Ham was the father of Canaan.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the three sons of Noah, and from them came the people who were scattered over the whole earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Noah, a man of the soil, proceeded to plant a vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he drank some of its wine, he became drunk and lay uncovered inside his tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ham, the father of Canaan, saw his father naked and told his two brothers outside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Shem and Japheth took a garment and laid it across their shoulders; then they walked in backward and covered their father’s naked body. Their faces were turned the other way so that they would not see their father naked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Noah awoke from his wine and found out what his youngest son had done to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he said,
“Cursed be Canaan!
    The lowest of slaves
    will he be to his brothers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He also said,
“Praise be to the Lord, the God of Shem!
    May Canaan be the slave of Shem.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: After the flood Noah lived 350 years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Noah lived a total of 950 years, and then he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the account of Shem, Ham and Japheth, Noah’s sons, who themselves had sons after the flood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Japheth:
Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshek and Tiras.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Gomer:
Ashkenaz, Riphath and Togarmah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Javan:
Elishah, Tarshish, the Kittites and the Rodanites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (From these the maritime peoples spread out into their territories by their clans within their nations, each with its own language.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Ham:
Cush, Egypt, Put and Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Cush:
Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah and Sabteka.
The sons of Raamah:
Sheba and Dedan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cush was the father of Nimrod, who became a mighty warrior on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was a mighty hunter before the Lord; that is why it is said, “Like Nimrod, a mighty hunter before the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first centers of his kingdom were Babylon, Uruk, Akkad and Kalneh, in Shinar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From that land he went to Assyria, where he built Nineveh, Rehoboth Ir, Calah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Resen, which is between Nineveh and Calah—which is the great city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Egypt was the father of
the Ludites, Anamites, Lehabites, Naphtuhites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pathrusites, Kasluhites (from whom the Philistines came) and Caphtorites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Canaan was the father of
Sidon his firstborn, and of the Hittites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jebusites, Amorites, Girgashites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hivites, Arkites, Sinites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Arvadites, Zemarites and Hamathites.
Later the Canaanite clans scattered
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the borders of Canaan reached from Sidon toward Gerar as far as Gaza, and then toward Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboyim, as far as Lasha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Ham by their clans and languages, in their territories and nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sons were also born to Shem, whose older brother was Japheth; Shem was the ancestor of all the sons of Eber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Shem:
Elam, Ashur, Arphaxad, Lud and Aram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Aram:
Uz, Hul, Gether and Meshek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Arphaxad was the father of Shelah,
and Shelah the father of Eber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Two sons were born to Eber:
One was named Peleg, because in his time the earth was divided; his brother was named Joktan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Joktan was the father of
Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obal, Abimael, Sheba,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ophir, Havilah and Jobab. All these were sons of Joktan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The region where they lived stretched from Mesha toward Sephar, in the eastern hill country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Shem by their clans and languages, in their territories and nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the clans of Noah’s sons, according to their lines of descent, within their nations. From these the nations spread out over the earth after the flood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the whole world had one language and a common speech.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As people moved eastward, they found a plain in Shinar and settled there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to each other, “Come, let’s make bricks and bake them thoroughly.” They used brick instead of stone, and tar for mortar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said, “Come, let us build ourselves a city, with a tower that reaches to the heavens, so that we may make a name for ourselves; otherwise we will be scattered over the face of the whole earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord came down to see the city and the tower the people were building.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “If as one people speaking the same language they have begun to do this, then nothing they plan to do will be impossible for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come, let us go down and confuse their language so they will not understand each other.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord scattered them from there over all the earth, and they stopped building the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is why it was called Babel—because there the Lord confused the language of the whole world. From there the Lord scattered them over the face of the whole earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the account of Shem’s family line.
Two years after the flood, when Shem was 100 years old, he became the father of Arphaxad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he became the father of Arphaxad, Shem lived 500 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Arphaxad had lived 35 years, he became the father of Shelah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he became the father of Shelah, Arphaxad lived 403 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Shelah had lived 30 years, he became the father of Eber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he became the father of Eber, Shelah lived 403 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Eber had lived 34 years, he became the father of Peleg.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he became the father of Peleg, Eber lived 430 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Peleg had lived 30 years, he became the father of Reu.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he became the father of Reu, Peleg lived 209 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Reu had lived 32 years, he became the father of Serug.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he became the father of Serug, Reu lived 207 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Serug had lived 30 years, he became the father of Nahor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he became the father of Nahor, Serug lived 200 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Nahor had lived 29 years, he became the father of Terah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he became the father of Terah, Nahor lived 119 years and had other sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Terah had lived 70 years, he became the father of Abram, Nahor and Haran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the account of Terah’s family line.
Terah became the father of Abram, Nahor and Haran. And Haran became the father of Lot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While his father Terah was still alive, Haran died in Ur of the Chaldeans, in the land of his birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abram and Nahor both married. The name of Abram’s wife was Sarai, and the name of Nahor’s wife was Milkah; she was the daughter of Haran, the father of both Milkah and Iskah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Sarai was childless because she was not able to conceive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Terah took his son Abram, his grandson Lot son of Haran, and his daughter-in-law Sarai, the wife of his son Abram, and together they set out from Ur of the Chaldeans to go to Canaan. But when they came to Harran, they settled there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Terah lived 205 years, and he died in Harran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord had said to Abram, “Go from your country, your people and your father’s household to the land I will show you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will make you into a great nation,
    and I will bless you;
I will make your name great,
    and you will be a blessing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will bless those who bless you,
    and whoever curses you I will curse;
and all peoples on earth
    will be blessed through you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abram went, as the Lord had told him; and Lot went with him. Abram was seventy-five years old when he set out from Harran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took his wife Sarai, his nephew Lot, all the possessions they had accumulated and the people they had acquired in Harran, and they set out for the land of Canaan, and they arrived there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abram traveled through the land as far as the site of the great tree of Moreh at Shechem. At that time the Canaanites were in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord appeared to Abram and said, “To your offspring I will give this land.” So he built an altar there to the Lord, who had appeared to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there he went on toward the hills east of Bethel and pitched his tent, with Bethel on the west and Ai on the east. There he built an altar to the Lord and called on the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abram set out and continued toward the Negev.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a famine in the land, and Abram went down to Egypt to live there for a while because the famine was severe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was about to enter Egypt, he said to his wife Sarai, “I know what a beautiful woman you are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Egyptians see you, they will say, ‘This is his wife.’ Then they will kill me but will let you live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say you are my sister, so that I will be treated well for your sake and my life will be spared because of you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Abram came to Egypt, the Egyptians saw that Sarai was a very beautiful woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Pharaoh’s officials saw her, they praised her to Pharaoh, and she was taken into his palace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He treated Abram well for her sake, and Abram acquired sheep and cattle, male and female donkeys, male and female servants, and camels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord inflicted serious diseases on Pharaoh and his household because of Abram’s wife Sarai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pharaoh summoned Abram. “What have you done to me?” he said. “Why didn’t you tell me she was your wife?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why did you say, ‘She is my sister,’ so that I took her to be my wife? Now then, here is your wife. Take her and go!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pharaoh gave orders about Abram to his men, and they sent him on his way, with his wife and everything he had.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abram went up from Egypt to the Negev, with his wife and everything he had, and Lot went with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abram had become very wealthy in livestock and in silver and gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the Negev he went from place to place until he came to Bethel, to the place between Bethel and Ai where his tent had been earlier
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and where he had first built an altar. There Abram called on the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Lot, who was moving about with Abram, also had flocks and herds and tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the land could not support them while they stayed together, for their possessions were so great that they were not able to stay together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And quarreling arose between Abram’s herders and Lot’s. The Canaanites and Perizzites were also living in the land at that time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abram said to Lot, “Let’s not have any quarreling between you and me, or between your herders and mine, for we are close relatives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not the whole land before you? Let’s part company. If you go to the left, I’ll go to the right; if you go to the right, I’ll go to the left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lot looked around and saw that the whole plain of the Jordan toward Zoar was well watered, like the garden of the Lord, like the land of Egypt. (This was before the Lord destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Lot chose for himself the whole plain of the Jordan and set out toward the east. The two men parted company:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abram lived in the land of Canaan, while Lot lived among the cities of the plain and pitched his tents near Sodom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the people of Sodom were wicked and were sinning greatly against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Abram after Lot had parted from him, “Look around from where you are, to the north and south, to the east and west.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the land that you see I will give to you and your offspring forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make your offspring like the dust of the earth, so that if anyone could count the dust, then your offspring could be counted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go, walk through the length and breadth of the land, for I am giving it to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abram went to live near the great trees of Mamre at Hebron, where he pitched his tents. There he built an altar to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the time when Amraphel was king of Shinar, Arioch king of Ellasar, Kedorlaomer king of Elam and Tidal king of Goyim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: these kings went to war against Bera king of Sodom, Birsha king of Gomorrah, Shinab king of Admah, Shemeber king of Zeboyim, and the king of Bela (that is, Zoar).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these latter kings joined forces in the Valley of Siddim (that is, the Dead Sea Valley).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For twelve years they had been subject to Kedorlaomer, but in the thirteenth year they rebelled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fourteenth year, Kedorlaomer and the kings allied with him went out and defeated the Rephaites in Ashteroth Karnaim, the Zuzites in Ham, the Emites in Shaveh Kiriathaim
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Horites in the hill country of Seir, as far as El Paran near the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they turned back and went to En Mishpat (that is, Kadesh), and they conquered the whole territory of the Amalekites, as well as the Amorites who were living in Hazezon Tamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king of Sodom, the king of Gomorrah, the king of Admah, the king of Zeboyim and the king of Bela (that is, Zoar) marched out and drew up their battle lines in the Valley of Siddim
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: against Kedorlaomer king of Elam, Tidal king of Goyim, Amraphel king of Shinar and Arioch king of Ellasar—four kings against five.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Valley of Siddim was full of tar pits, and when the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah fled, some of the men fell into them and the rest fled to the hills.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The four kings seized all the goods of Sodom and Gomorrah and all their food; then they went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also carried off Abram’s nephew Lot and his possessions, since he was living in Sodom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man who had escaped came and reported this to Abram the Hebrew. Now Abram was living near the great trees of Mamre the Amorite, a brother of Eshkol and Aner, all of whom were allied with Abram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Abram heard that his relative had been taken captive, he called out the 318 trained men born in his household and went in pursuit as far as Dan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During the night Abram divided his men to attack them and he routed them, pursuing them as far as Hobah, north of Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He recovered all the goods and brought back his relative Lot and his possessions, together with the women and the other people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Abram returned from defeating Kedorlaomer and the kings allied with him, the king of Sodom came out to meet him in the Valley of Shaveh (that is, the King’s Valley).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Melchizedek king of Salem brought out bread and wine. He was priest of God Most High,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and he blessed Abram, saying,
“Blessed be Abram by God Most High,
    Creator of heaven and earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And praise be to God Most High,
    who delivered your enemies into your hand.”
Then Abram gave him a tenth of everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king of Sodom said to Abram, “Give me the people and keep the goods for yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Abram said to the king of Sodom, “With raised hand I have sworn an oath to the Lord, God Most High, Creator of heaven and earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that I will accept nothing belonging to you, not even a thread or the strap of a sandal, so that you will never be able to say, ‘I made Abram rich.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will accept nothing but what my men have eaten and the share that belongs to the men who went with me—to Aner, Eshkol and Mamre. Let them have their share.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
After this, the word of the Lord came to Abram in a vision:
“Do not be afraid, Abram.
    I am your shield,
    your very great reward.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Abram said, “Sovereign Lord, what can you give me since I remain childless and the one who will inherit my estate is Eliezer of Damascus?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abram said, “You have given me no children; so a servant in my household will be my heir.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to him: “This man will not be your heir, but a son who is your own flesh and blood will be your heir.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took him outside and said, “Look up at the sky and count the stars—if indeed you can count them.” Then he said to him, “So shall your offspring be.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abram believed the Lord, and he credited it to him as righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also said to him, “I am the Lord, who brought you out of Ur of the Chaldeans to give you this land to take possession of it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Abram said, “Sovereign Lord, how can I know that I will gain possession of it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord said to him, “Bring me a heifer, a goat and a ram, each three years old, along with a dove and a young pigeon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abram brought all these to him, cut them in two and arranged the halves opposite each other; the birds, however, he did not cut in half.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then birds of prey came down on the carcasses, but Abram drove them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the sun was setting, Abram fell into a deep sleep, and a thick and dreadful darkness came over him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to him, “Know for certain that for four hundred years your descendants will be strangers in a country not their own and that they will be enslaved and mistreated there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will punish the nation they serve as slaves, and afterward they will come out with great possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You, however, will go to your ancestors in peace and be buried at a good old age.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fourth generation your descendants will come back here, for the sin of the Amorites has not yet reached its full measure.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the sun had set and darkness had fallen, a smoking firepot with a blazing torch appeared and passed between the pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day the Lord made a covenant with Abram and said, “To your descendants I give this land, from the Wadi of Egypt to the great river, the Euphrates—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the land of the Kenites, Kenizzites, Kadmonites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hittites, Perizzites, Rephaites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amorites, Canaanites, Girgashites and Jebusites.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Sarai, Abram’s wife, had borne him no children. But she had an Egyptian slave named Hagar;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so she said to Abram, “The Lord has kept me from having children. Go, sleep with my slave; perhaps I can build a family through her.”
Abram agreed to what Sarai said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So after Abram had been living in Canaan ten years, Sarai his wife took her Egyptian slave Hagar and gave her to her husband to be his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He slept with Hagar, and she conceived.
When she knew she was pregnant, she began to despise her mistress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Sarai said to Abram, “You are responsible for the wrong I am suffering. I put my slave in your arms, and now that she knows she is pregnant, she despises me. May the Lord judge between you and me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Your slave is in your hands,” Abram said. “Do with her whatever you think best.” Then Sarai mistreated Hagar; so she fled from her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel of the Lord found Hagar near a spring in the desert; it was the spring that is beside the road to Shur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And he said, “Hagar, slave of Sarai, where have you come from, and where are you going?”
“I’m running away from my mistress Sarai,” she answered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel of the Lord told her, “Go back to your mistress and submit to her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel added, “I will increase your descendants so much that they will be too numerous to count.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The angel of the Lord also said to her:
“You are now pregnant
    and you will give birth to a son.
You shall name him Ishmael,
    for the Lord has heard of your misery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will be a wild donkey of a man;
    his hand will be against everyone
    and everyone’s hand against him,
and he will live in hostility
    toward all his brothers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She gave this name to the Lord who spoke to her: “You are the God who sees me,” for she said, “I have now seen the One who sees me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is why the well was called Beer Lahai Roi; it is still there, between Kadesh and Bered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Hagar bore Abram a son, and Abram gave the name Ishmael to the son she had borne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abram was eighty-six years old when Hagar bore him Ishmael.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Abram was ninety-nine years old, the Lord appeared to him and said, “I am God Almighty; walk before me faithfully and be blameless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will make my covenant between me and you and will greatly increase your numbers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abram fell facedown, and God said to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for me, this is my covenant with you: You will be the father of many nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No longer will you be called Abram; your name will be Abraham, for I have made you a father of many nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make you very fruitful; I will make nations of you, and kings will come from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will establish my covenant as an everlasting covenant between me and you and your descendants after you for the generations to come, to be your God and the God of your descendants after you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole land of Canaan, where you now reside as a foreigner, I will give as an everlasting possession to you and your descendants after you; and I will be their God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God said to Abraham, “As for you, you must keep my covenant, you and your descendants after you for the generations to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is my covenant with you and your descendants after you, the covenant you are to keep: Every male among you shall be circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to undergo circumcision, and it will be the sign of the covenant between me and you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the generations to come every male among you who is eight days old must be circumcised, including those born in your household or bought with money from a foreigner—those who are not your offspring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whether born in your household or bought with your money, they must be circumcised. My covenant in your flesh is to be an everlasting covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Any uncircumcised male, who has not been circumcised in the flesh, will be cut off from his people; he has broken my covenant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God also said to Abraham, “As for Sarai your wife, you are no longer to call her Sarai; her name will be Sarah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bless her and will surely give you a son by her. I will bless her so that she will be the mother of nations; kings of peoples will come from her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham fell facedown; he laughed and said to himself, “Will a son be born to a man a hundred years old? Will Sarah bear a child at the age of ninety?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abraham said to God, “If only Ishmael might live under your blessing!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God said, “Yes, but your wife Sarah will bear you a son, and you will call him Isaac. I will establish my covenant with him as an everlasting covenant for his descendants after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as for Ishmael, I have heard you: I will surely bless him; I will make him fruitful and will greatly increase his numbers. He will be the father of twelve rulers, and I will make him into a great nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But my covenant I will establish with Isaac, whom Sarah will bear to you by this time next year.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had finished speaking with Abraham, God went up from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that very day Abraham took his son Ishmael and all those born in his household or bought with his money, every male in his household, and circumcised them, as God told him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham was ninety-nine years old when he was circumcised,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his son Ishmael was thirteen;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham and his son Ishmael were both circumcised on that very day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every male in Abraham’s household, including those born in his household or bought from a foreigner, was circumcised with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord appeared to Abraham near the great trees of Mamre while he was sitting at the entrance to his tent in the heat of the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham looked up and saw three men standing nearby. When he saw them, he hurried from the entrance of his tent to meet them and bowed low to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “If I have found favor in your eyes, my lord, do not pass your servant by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let a little water be brought, and then you may all wash your feet and rest under this tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let me get you something to eat, so you can be refreshed and then go on your way—now that you have come to your servant.”
“Very well,” they answered, “do as you say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Abraham hurried into the tent to Sarah. “Quick,” he said, “get three seahs of the finest flour and knead it and bake some bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he ran to the herd and selected a choice, tender calf and gave it to a servant, who hurried to prepare it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He then brought some curds and milk and the calf that had been prepared, and set these before them. While they ate, he stood near them under a tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Where is your wife Sarah?” they asked him.
“There, in the tent,” he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then one of them said, “I will surely return to you about this time next year, and Sarah your wife will have a son.”
Now Sarah was listening at the entrance to the tent, which was behind him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham and Sarah were already very old, and Sarah was past the age of childbearing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Sarah laughed to herself as she thought, “After I am worn out and my lord is old, will I now have this pleasure?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Abraham, “Why did Sarah laugh and say, ‘Will I really have a child, now that I am old?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is anything too hard for the Lord? I will return to you at the appointed time next year, and Sarah will have a son.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sarah was afraid, so she lied and said, “I did not laugh.”
But he said, “Yes, you did laugh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the men got up to leave, they looked down toward Sodom, and Abraham walked along with them to see them on their way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said, “Shall I hide from Abraham what I am about to do?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham will surely become a great and powerful nation, and all nations on earth will be blessed through him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have chosen him, so that he will direct his children and his household after him to keep the way of the Lord by doing what is right and just, so that the Lord will bring about for Abraham what he has promised him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said, “The outcry against Sodom and Gomorrah is so great and their sin so grievous
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that I will go down and see if what they have done is as bad as the outcry that has reached me. If not, I will know.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men turned away and went toward Sodom, but Abraham remained standing before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abraham approached him and said: “Will you sweep away the righteous with the wicked?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What if there are fifty righteous people in the city? Will you really sweep it away and not spare the place for the sake of the fifty righteous people in it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Far be it from you to do such a thing—to kill the righteous with the wicked, treating the righteous and the wicked alike. Far be it from you! Will not the Judge of all the earth do right?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “If I find fifty righteous people in the city of Sodom, I will spare the whole place for their sake.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abraham spoke up again: “Now that I have been so bold as to speak to the Lord, though I am nothing but dust and ashes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
what if the number of the righteous is five less than fifty? Will you destroy the whole city for lack of five people?”
“If I find forty-five there,” he said, “I will not destroy it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Once again he spoke to him, “What if only forty are found there?”
He said, “For the sake of forty, I will not do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he said, “May the Lord not be angry, but let me speak. What if only thirty can be found there?”
He answered, “I will not do it if I find thirty there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Abraham said, “Now that I have been so bold as to speak to the Lord, what if only twenty can be found there?”
He said, “For the sake of twenty, I will not destroy it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he said, “May the Lord not be angry, but let me speak just once more. What if only ten can be found there?”
He answered, “For the sake of ten, I will not destroy it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Lord had finished speaking with Abraham, he left, and Abraham returned home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The two angels arrived at Sodom in the evening, and Lot was sitting in the gateway of the city. When he saw them, he got up to meet them and bowed down with his face to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“My lords,” he said, “please turn aside to your servant’s house. You can wash your feet and spend the night and then go on your way early in the morning.”
“No,” they answered, “we will spend the night in the square.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he insisted so strongly that they did go with him and entered his house. He prepared a meal for them, baking bread without yeast, and they ate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before they had gone to bed, all the men from every part of the city of Sodom—both young and old—surrounded the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They called to Lot, “Where are the men who came to you tonight? Bring them out to us so that we can have sex with them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lot went outside to meet them and shut the door behind him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “No, my friends. Don’t do this wicked thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, I have two daughters who have never slept with a man. Let me bring them out to you, and you can do what you like with them. But don’t do anything to these men, for they have come under the protection of my roof.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Get out of our way,” they replied. “This fellow came here as a foreigner, and now he wants to play the judge! We’ll treat you worse than them.” They kept bringing pressure on Lot and moved forward to break down the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the men inside reached out and pulled Lot back into the house and shut the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they struck the men who were at the door of the house, young and old, with blindness so that they could not find the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The two men said to Lot, “Do you have anyone else here—sons-in-law, sons or daughters, or anyone else in the city who belongs to you? Get them out of here,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because we are going to destroy this place. The outcry to the Lord against its people is so great that he has sent us to destroy it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Lot went out and spoke to his sons-in-law, who were pledged to marry his daughters. He said, “Hurry and get out of this place, because the Lord is about to destroy the city!” But his sons-in-law thought he was joking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With the coming of dawn, the angels urged Lot, saying, “Hurry! Take your wife and your two daughters who are here, or you will be swept away when the city is punished.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he hesitated, the men grasped his hand and the hands of his wife and of his two daughters and led them safely out of the city, for the Lord was merciful to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as they had brought them out, one of them said, “Flee for your lives! Don’t look back, and don’t stop anywhere in the plain! Flee to the mountains or you will be swept away!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Lot said to them, “No, my lords, please!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your servant has found favor in your eyes, and you have shown great kindness to me in sparing my life. But I can’t flee to the mountains; this disaster will overtake me, and I’ll die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, here is a town near enough to run to, and it is small. Let me flee to it—it is very small, isn’t it? Then my life will be spared.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to him, “Very well, I will grant this request too; I will not overthrow the town you speak of.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But flee there quickly, because I cannot do anything until you reach it.” (That is why the town was called Zoar.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By the time Lot reached Zoar, the sun had risen over the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord rained down burning sulfur on Sodom and Gomorrah—from the Lord out of the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus he overthrew those cities and the entire plain, destroying all those living in the cities—and also the vegetation in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Lot’s wife looked back, and she became a pillar of salt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Early the next morning Abraham got up and returned to the place where he had stood before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He looked down toward Sodom and Gomorrah, toward all the land of the plain, and he saw dense smoke rising from the land, like smoke from a furnace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when God destroyed the cities of the plain, he remembered Abraham, and he brought Lot out of the catastrophe that overthrew the cities where Lot had lived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lot and his two daughters left Zoar and settled in the mountains, for he was afraid to stay in Zoar. He and his two daughters lived in a cave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day the older daughter said to the younger, “Our father is old, and there is no man around here to give us children—as is the custom all over the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let’s get our father to drink wine and then sleep with him and preserve our family line through our father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That night they got their father to drink wine, and the older daughter went in and slept with him. He was not aware of it when she lay down or when she got up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day the older daughter said to the younger, “Last night I slept with my father. Let’s get him to drink wine again tonight, and you go in and sleep with him so we can preserve our family line through our father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they got their father to drink wine that night also, and the younger daughter went in and slept with him. Again he was not aware of it when she lay down or when she got up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So both of Lot’s daughters became pregnant by their father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The older daughter had a son, and she named him Moab; he is the father of the Moabites of today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The younger daughter also had a son, and she named him Ben-Ammi; he is the father of the Ammonites of today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Abraham moved on from there into the region of the Negev and lived between Kadesh and Shur. For a while he stayed in Gerar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there Abraham said of his wife Sarah, “She is my sister.” Then Abimelek king of Gerar sent for Sarah and took her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God came to Abimelek in a dream one night and said to him, “You are as good as dead because of the woman you have taken; she is a married woman.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Abimelek had not gone near her, so he said, “Lord, will you destroy an innocent nation?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did he not say to me, ‘She is my sister,’ and didn’t she also say, ‘He is my brother’? I have done this with a clear conscience and clean hands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God said to him in the dream, “Yes, I know you did this with a clear conscience, and so I have kept you from sinning against me. That is why I did not let you touch her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now return the man’s wife, for he is a prophet, and he will pray for you and you will live. But if you do not return her, you may be sure that you and all who belong to you will die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Early the next morning Abimelek summoned all his officials, and when he told them all that had happened, they were very much afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abimelek called Abraham in and said, “What have you done to us? How have I wronged you that you have brought such great guilt upon me and my kingdom? You have done things to me that should never be done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abimelek asked Abraham, “What was your reason for doing this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham replied, “I said to myself, ‘There is surely no fear of God in this place, and they will kill me because of my wife.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Besides, she really is my sister, the daughter of my father though not of my mother; and she became my wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when God had me wander from my father’s household, I said to her, ‘This is how you can show your love to me: Everywhere we go, say of me, “He is my brother.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abimelek brought sheep and cattle and male and female slaves and gave them to Abraham, and he returned Sarah his wife to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Abimelek said, “My land is before you; live wherever you like.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Sarah he said, “I am giving your brother a thousand shekels of silver. This is to cover the offense against you before all who are with you; you are completely vindicated.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Abraham prayed to God, and God healed Abimelek, his wife and his female slaves so they could have children again,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the Lord had kept all the women in Abimelek’s household from conceiving because of Abraham’s wife Sarah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord was gracious to Sarah as he had said, and the Lord did for Sarah what he had promised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sarah became pregnant and bore a son to Abraham in his old age, at the very time God had promised him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham gave the name Isaac to the son Sarah bore him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When his son Isaac was eight days old, Abraham circumcised him, as God commanded him.
